column4: How can I log in as "Root" user so I can delete this annoying partition I don't wish to see anymore on my Desktop?
: gksu gparted
then type your password
Even after doing that and putting in password when I try to unmount the drive I get issue about not having the privilege?
that should give you root privliges
doesn't seemed to have worked..
your not trying to unmount a drive you are using are you?
nah, not using that drive
: Try going to System >> Administration >> GNOME partition editor
its not listed there buddy
check personal message in red at top
: open up a terminal and type gksu apt-get install gparted
ok will try that
let me know if it installls it
doesn't appear to install it. After it asks me to accept and put in password nothing happens.
Do you think I should restart or something?
: no
what version are you using?
it wont let you install gparted
Why?
I think I am going to do a reformat and start a fresh and properly sort things out.
ok
Thank you very much for ur help :)
